metadata.title: CVE-2025-21502 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM for JDK, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition product of Oracle Java SE (component: Hotspot).Supported versions that are affected are Oracle Java SE: 8u431-perf,11.0.25, 17.0.13, 21.0.5, 23.0.1; Oracle GraalVM for JDK: 17.0.13, 21.0.5,23.0.1; Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition: 20.3.16 and  21.3.12. Difficultto exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVMfor JDK, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition.  Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in  unauthorized update, insert or delete accessto some of Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM for JDK, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition accessible data as well as  unauthorized read access toa subset of Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM for JDK, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition accessible data. Note: This vulnerability can beexploited by using APIs in the specified Component, e.g., through a webservice which supplies data to the APIs. This vulnerability also applies toJava deployments, typically in clients running sandboxed Java Web Startapplications or sandboxed Java applets, that load and run untrusted code(e.g., code that comes from the internet) and rely on the Java sandbox forsecurity. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.8 (Confidentiality and Integrity impacts).CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2025-21502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04
No subscription required

openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-17-source - 17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1
No subscription required

openjdk-21-demo - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-jdk - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-jdk-headless - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-jre - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-jre-headless - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-jre-zero - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-source - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
openjdk-21-testsupport - 21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-lts package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.0.26+4-1ubuntu1~22.04').
openjdk-17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.0.14+7-1~22.04.1').
openjdk-18: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by openjdk-19').
openjdk-19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no longer supported by upstream').
openjdk-21 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '21.0.6+7-1~22.04.1').
